name: Rose Grape
description: Medinilla magnifica, commonly known as Rose Grape, Showy Medinilla, or Malaysian Orchid, is an epiphytic flowering plant native to the Philippines, particularly in tropical rainforests. It belongs to the Melastomataceae family and features large, leathery, dark green leaves (20-30 cm long) with prominent veins. The plant produces spectacular pendulous flower clusters (30-50 cm long) with pink to magenta bracts and small, pink to purple flowers that resemble grapes, hence the common name. The plant displays an upright, bushy growth habit and typically reaches 30-50 cm in height. In its native habitat, it grows as an epiphyte on tree trunks and branches in humid, tropical forests. In terrariums or indoor settings, this plant adds stunning floral displays with its dramatic, pendulous flower clusters. It's popular among plant collectors for its spectacular blooms, though it can be challenging to grow.
